title: Raheem Sterling and Tammy Abraham link-up with Premier League in No Room For Racism video
text:
The Premier League has teamed up with stars from all 20 top-flight sides - including Raheem Sterling, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Tammy Abraham - to make a stand against racism.

'If you see it, report it' is the message to match-going fans, accompanying the launch of the No Room For Racism campaign.

The video is the latest reaction to the shocking scenes during England's 6-0 thrashing of Bulgaria - when play had to be stopped twice because of racism directed at England players.

Tammy Abraham and Joe Willock say 'No Room For Racism' in new Premier League's new video

The launch urges: 'if you see it, report it', and follows shocking scenes in England 6-0 Bulgaria

England players suffered racist abuse in the game - the aftermath of which has seen 12 arrests

In the fallout, the manager and entire executive committee of the Bulgaria Football Union has resigned, 12 fans have been arrested and both nations have been charged.

The video features lines such as 'there's room for drama, but there is no room for racism' - with Abraham the first player to appear. The Chelsea striker was subjected to abuse online earlier this season after shoot-out defeat in the Super Cup to Liverpool.

The Bulgarian Football Union's president resigned, along with the entire executive committee

'We will not tolerate racism in any form and urge anybody who witnesses racist behaviour to report it,' Premier League Interim Chief Executive Richard Masters said in a statement.

'We are open to everyone and welcome all the supporters who bring passion, emotion and rivalry to create a positive matchday atmosphere, but we want to make it clear – there is no room for racism.'

The No Room For Racism campaign will be visible at all Premier League matches from Saturday 19 to Sunday 27 October.

The statement added that the Premier League are reviewing how offenders are identified and sanctioned. It also outlined that senior stewards have received training in evidence-gathering, using technology such as increased CCTV coverage at grounds and bodycams to discourage offending behaviour and aid the identification of offenders.

Anyone who witnesses racist behaviour at a match or around a stadium is advised to report it to a steward or the police, or via the Kick It Out reporting app.
description: The Premier League has teamed up with stars from all 20 top-flight sides - including Raheem Sterling, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Tammy Abraham - to make a stand against racism.
